text: It is never too late for a man to learn.
Rally the troops, and muster the volunteers - war is no time for idleness.
Let no archer be without arrows, so the sky may become as rain.
By granting more resources to loyal local leaders, they can be ordered to improve their lands in your stead.
Without proper care and feed for the mounts, the effectiveness of cavalry has its limitations.
It is important to ensure all of your soldiers' equipment is well looked after - a splintered shaft or broken spearhead can doom a formation.
Take stock in the equipment of your men, and replace damaged or ill-fitting armor pieces with those in surplus if needed - it may save both their lives, and your campaign.
